pr_title: CORE: Fix allowed resource recognition, assignGroup optimization

timeline.message:
CORE: Fixed wrong member status in getAllowedResources(facility,user)

- If user is disabled, we shouldn't return such resources as allowed.
  Previously it returned also disabled members, since only invalid
  status was excluded.

CORE: Throw exception if module for virt attribute doesn't exists

- We silently returned null instead of ModuleNotExistsException for
  following attribute types: member_group, member_resource, group_resource.
  Now implementation is aligned for all attribute types.

CORE: Optimized performance in group assigning

- Set group and group_resource required attributes together.
- We now set required attributes only to the valid, expired
  and suspended group members (same as assign service does).
- Optimized isTrulyRequired(user,facility), now we resolve
  allowed resources and check required attributes on them.
  For true it previously double checked allowed facilities,
  assigned and allowed resources.
- Fixed getAllowedResources(member) which previously returned
  also resources, where member was disabled. Now its aligned
  with recently fixed getAllowedResources(user,facility).

timeline.bodyText: I just would like to ask, why is this change made only to these three methods and not to all of them? This way, the module accessing methods behave differently for different combinations of entities.
timeline.author: Vojtech-Sassmann

replies.bodyText: Module is "required" only for virtual attributes, since it implements getAttributeValue() to actually compute the value. Other getters for virtual attribute modules were already correct, so this commit fixes implementation to be consistent for all virtual attributes.
replies.author: zlamalp

replies.bodyText: I see, thanks for the explanation.
replies.author: Vojtech-Sassmann
